text: What is the main focus of Day 65?
options: Web design principles including UX/UI, color theory, and typography
explanation: Day 65 is 'Web Design School' focusing on design principles to make websites people will love.

text: What does UX stand for?
explanation: UX (User Experience) refers to how a user feels when interacting with a product or website.

text: What does UI stand for?
explanation: UI (User Interface) refers to the visual elements and interactive components of a product.

text: Which of the following is a primary color in the RGB color model?
explanation: RGB stands for Red, Green, Blue - the primary colors used in digital displays.

text: What are complementary colors?
options: Colors that are next to each other on the color wheel.
Colors that are opposite each other on the color wheel.
Different shades of the same color.
Colors that blend together when mixed.
explanation: Complementary colors are opposite on the color wheel and create high contrast when used together.

text: What is the difference between serif and sans-serif fonts?
options: Serif fonts are modern; sans-serif fonts are traditional.
Serif fonts have decorative strokes at the ends of letters; sans-serif fonts don't.
Sans-serif fonts are only used for headlines.
explanation: Serif fonts (like Times New Roman) have small strokes at the ends of characters. Sans-serif (like Arial) don't.

text: What is the recommended maximum number of font families to use on a single website?
explanation: Using 2-3 font families maintains visual consistency while allowing for hierarchy.

text: What is 'visual hierarchy' in web design?
options: The order in which files are loaded.
The arrangement of elements to show their order of importance.
The folder structure of a project.
explanation: Visual hierarchy uses size, color, and placement to guide users' attention to the most important elements first.

text: What is 'white space' (or negative space) in design?
options: Space that is always colored white.
Empty space between and around elements.
The background color of a website.
explanation: White space refers to empty areas in a design that help elements breathe and improve readability.

text: What is the 60-30-10 rule in color design?
options: 60% of users prefer blue, 30% prefer green, 10% prefer red.
A color ratio: 60% dominant color, 30% secondary color, 10% accent color.
explanation: The 60-30-10 rule creates balanced color schemes: 60% dominant, 30% secondary, 10% accent.

text: What is the purpose of a 'call to action' (CTA) button?
options: To encourage users to take a specific action (sign up, buy, etc.).
To navigate to the home page.
explanation: CTAs guide users toward conversion goals like signing up, purchasing, or subscribing.

text: What is 'responsive design'?
options: A design that responds to user clicks quickly.
A design that adapts to different screen sizes and devices.
A design that uses JavaScript for animations.
A design with fast server response times.
explanation: Responsive design ensures websites look good on all devices, from phones to desktop monitors.

text: Which website can you use to find harmonious color palettes?
explanation: Color Hunt and Adobe Color are popular tools for discovering and creating color palettes.

text: What is 'contrast' in web design?
options: The difference in brightness between two colors.
The difference in visual properties that makes elements distinguishable.
explanation: Contrast creates visual interest and helps distinguish different elements. It's crucial for accessibility.

text: What is the F-pattern in web design?
options: A layout that looks like the letter F.
The natural eye-scanning pattern users follow when reading web content.
explanation: Studies show users scan web pages in an F-shaped pattern: across the top, then down the left side.

text:
CSS Color Variables
Define CSS custom properties for a primary color (#3B82F6) and an accent color (#10B981).
explanation: CSS custom properties (variables) make it easy to maintain consistent colors across a design.

text:
Typography Scale
Create CSS for a heading hierarchy: h1 (2.5rem), h2 (2rem), h3 (1.5rem).
explanation: A consistent type scale creates visual hierarchy and improves readability.

text:
Button Styling
Create a CTA button style with padding, rounded corners, and a hover effect.
explanation: Good button design includes padding, clear colors, and interactive feedback on hover.

text:
Responsive Container
Create a container class that centers content and has max-width of 1200px with auto margins.
explanation: max-width with margin: 0 auto centers content while keeping it responsive.

text:
Card Component
Create a card style with shadow, rounded corners, and padding.
explanation: Cards with shadows create depth and visual separation between content sections.

text: The text is hard to read against the background. Fix the contrast issue.
options: color: #fff; (use white text on dark background)
explanation: Low contrast between text and background makes content hard to read. Use high contrast colors.

text: The design looks cluttered. What CSS property should be increased?
options: Increase padding and margin for more white space
explanation: Increasing padding and margins adds white space, making the design feel less cluttered.

text: The website uses 5 different fonts. What's the design problem?
options: Too many fonts - reduce to 2-3 for consistency
explanation: Using too many fonts creates visual chaos. Limit to 2-3 font families maximum.
